alert.note: Alert for Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 7:39AM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. Snowfall amounts will be highly variable across the region. Although brief, snow will fall heavy at times with snowfall rates of up to 2 inches per hour. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Pikes Peak, Teller County and the Rampart Range, and northern El Paso County. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery roads and rapidly deteriorating conditions under the heavier snow bands. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Given the localized nature to the heavier snow bands, travelers should be prepared for the possibility of rapidly changing conditions over short distances.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
